wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Richard Harte Keatinge Butler  (28 August 1870 – 22 April 1935) was a British Army general during the First World War. He was Chief of Staff to First Army for much of 1915, then Deputy Chief of Staff to the BEF from the end of 1915 to the start of 1918. For much of 1918 he commanded III Corps in the front line.

When Sir Douglas Haig was promoted to Commander-in-Chief of the BEF in December 1915, Kiggell was appointed Chief of General Staff to the BEF. Richard Butler, Haig's preferred choice, was considered too junior for the role. Kiggell would hold this position until early 1918. Kiggell was awarded the KCB in 1916. On 1 January 1917, he was promoted to temporary Lieutenant-General. Wilson, liaising with French Grand Quartier General early in 1917, claimed that Kiggell "hated the French".Jeffery 2006, pp 190–1
